Node.definition: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= action by which someone takes much more time than expected to do something; ≈ possibly with an implicit connotation of bringing some sort of disappointment to those expecting
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) younger brother of Miriam (מִרְיָם) and Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► leader of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) during exodus

= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) brother of Moses (מֹשֶׁה) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► first high priest (כֹּהֵן)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or objects to go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot or carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

= metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

meaning not completely sure: = object; ► used as tool in the process of molding images

= action by which humans produce musical sounds with their voice, often as a celebratory response, either set to a prescribed tune or spontaneous
= events that require the ability to accomplish great things through characteristics such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= action by which humans produce musical sounds with their voice, often as a celebratory response, either set to a prescribed tune or spontaneous
= state in which humans have been unable to overcome the enemy due to lack of physical strength
= action by which humans produce musical sounds with their voice, often as a celebratory response, either set to a prescribed tune or spontaneous
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes

Node.gloss: to approach|to come near|to come forward
Node.definition: = action by which humans or animals move to a location relatively close to the location in focus
= open area where people are living in tents or other temporary dwellings for a limited amount of time and often for a specific purpose, such as nomads or soldiers

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= male young of a cow (פָּרָה) ► used as a symbol for a deity; also used as sacrifice; ≈ associated with being willful and untrained
= action by which humans dance a round dance; ≈ associated with joy
= process by which the anger (אַף) of humans and deities is aroused ◄ like a fire that is kindled
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) younger brother of Miriam (מִרְיָם) and Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► leader of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) during exodus

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= small, flat tablet, ◄ made of stone, ► on which words were scratched with a stylus; ≈ associated with conditions that are permanent and are not likely to change

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= male young of a cow (פָּרָה) ► used as a symbol for a deity; also used as sacrifice; ≈ associated with being willful and untrained
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= causative action by which humans reduce objects to tiny particles or powder with the help of a hand mill or larger millstone; ≈ regarded as a menial task
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
= state in which an object has been reduced to fine particles
= causative action by which humans cause a substance or a set of small objects to divide itself and move into various directions

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) younger brother of Miriam (מִרְיָם) and Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► leader of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) during exodus
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) brother of Moses (מֹשֶׁה) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► first high priest (כֹּהֵן)

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= state in which a human being is responsible for a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether committed on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= state in which an event has a high intensity

= process by which the anger (אַף) of humans and deities is aroused ◄ like a fire that is kindled
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= man who is in a position of authority over another person or object as a legal owner, employer, husband, or sovereign; or a person or deity who is referred to as such in a conversation or prayer
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong
